timeline.author: valfirst
valfirst

timeline.bodyText: I recommend to make this method abstract and keep empty implementation in child classes
timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText:
Given("I start mobile application located at $location")?
Why are capabilities needed?
timeline.author: valfirst

replies.bodyText:
Although we have an opportunity to set desired capabilities thorough meta at story level, by setting desired capabilities at step level we could use it in conjunction with lifecycle ET to run the same story several times on different devices
Imho this is more clear way to setup properties than at meta level
replies.author: uarlouski

replies.bodyText:
would not it better to name it
Given I start mobile application with capabilities: capabilities
?
replies.author: uarlouski

timeline.bodyText: I think we'll remove SauceLabsCapabilityType.java at some point, so I don't recommend to keep using it
timeline.author: valfirst

timeline.bodyText: there are both setter and @Inject, something is redundant

valfirst

timeline.bodyText: don't you mind to align it with getPropertyValuesTreeByPrefix?
timeline.author: ikalinin1

timeline.bodyText:
Why it can't be part of mobile-app plugin?
If you starting web profile you will have RemoteDriverFactory if you starting the mobile app profile you will have an available factory for ios/android
timeline.author: ikalinin1
ikalinin1

replies.bodyText: due to @nAmed and generic package that we scan converters are loaded regardless of the current profile, so when we start up mobile_app profile this converter is registered as a bean, but since it has dependencies on beans from web profile, the spring context startup fails
replies.author: uarlouski
